author: Special Correspondent
text:
Scores of child cancer patients will decorate with gold ribbons a replica of the Taj Mahal on Sunday as part of observing International Childhood Cancer Awareness Day.

The NGO CanKids will help the children to decorate the replica. A day-long activities have been planned and it will be hosted by the Department of Medical Oncology, Regional Cancer Centre, Jipmer, along with Jiv Daya foundation and The Rotary Club Beach Town, Pondicherry.

According to CanKids, since 1978, the gold ribbon and gold light have been the symbol representing the world’s youngest cancer patients and honours their courageous struggle against child and adolescent cancer. Gold is the chosen colour for childhood cancers.

It indicates that children are as precious and priceless as gold. It is also to apprise the authorities that childhood cancer must be a priority for the country.

Initiative

in September

The international theme for the year is ‘Go Gold for children with Cancer and their families worldwide’ and CanKids has scheduled a ‘Light it up gold Taj Mahal’ initiative in September.

The day will begin with a rally from the Kargil War memorial on the beach road and end near the Gandhi Statue. Students from various schools and colleges in the city, staff and students of Jipmer will join hands with childhood cancer survivors and their caretakers, to show their solidarity and support in the fight against cancer.

This will be followed by various cultural and entertainment programs including magic show and a cancer awareness lecture at the Kargil war memorial.
title: Child cancer patients to decorate replica of Taj with gold ribbons
